news.heading: Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC)
news.content: Armed violence in Ituri province resulted in the deaths of 57 civilians and the displacement of 30,000 people. This surge in violence is linked to military operations against various armed groups.
news.source: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

news.heading: Ghana
news.content: The country's anti-graft agency has charged the former head of the petroleum regulator and six others over a $28 million corruption and money laundering scheme.The country's anti-graft agency has charged the former head of the petroleum regulator and six others over a $28 million corruption and money laundering scheme.

news.heading: Togo
news.content: Tensions were high as local government elections were held following weeks of public protests calling for President Faure Gnassingbe to resign.

news.heading: Sudan
news.content: The conflict is fueling the flow of sophisticated, looted weapons into neighboring South Sudan, violating a U.N. arms embargo.

news.heading: France-Senegal Relations
news.content: French military forces officially withdrew their last troops from bases in Senegal, marking the end of a three-month departure process that began in March.

news.heading: Gambia
news.content: The UN Environment Programme (UNEP) highlighted how The Gambia is confronting climate change to slow a youth exodus, a socio-economic issue driven by environmental degradation.

news.heading: Gaza
news.content: The World Health Organization (WHO) confirmed around 100 people died of malnutrition-related deaths by the end of July.

news.heading: Haiti
news.content: The UN has warned of fresh displacement in Haiti, with the humanitarian situation continuing to deteriorate due to armed conflict and natural disasters.

news.heading: Sudan
news.content: Aid organizations have warned that Sudan is on the brink of a massive famine, with over 18 million people facing acute food insecurity.

news.heading: Democratic Republic of the Congo (DRC)
news.content: The government and the M23 rebel group agreed to a halt in fighting and to work towards a truce, though violence in the region continues.

news.heading: Philippines
news.content: The Department of Foreign Affairs of the Philippines, on the 9th anniversary of the South China Sea Arbitral Award, reaffirmed the ruling which invalidated China's claims in the region.

news.heading: Cambodia
news.content: Political uncertainty and border disputes with Thailand continue to be a headwind for the Thai economy, dampening investor appetite in the region.

news.heading: South Korea & Taiwan
news.content: Both countries attracted their strongest monthly foreign investment inflows in July since February 2024, driven by a global surge of interest in AI-related industries and shareholder-friendly reforms.

news.heading: Japan
news.content: The U.S. and Japan reached a new trade agreement, setting tariffs on Japanese goods at 15%. This deal, a significant reduction from previously considered tariffs, is expected to support the Japanese stock market and the yen.

news.heading: Vietnam
news.content: Foreign funds flowed into Vietnam in July, with investors encouraged by the country’s strong growth outlook and a favorable tariff arrangement recently secured with the United States.

news.heading: China
news.content: Researchers reported the first wafer-scale fabrication of two-dimensional indium selenide (InSe) semiconductors, which could surpass silicon in performance.
news.source: The China Science and Technology Daily

news.heading: Japan
news.content: In two Phase I trials, doctors safely implanted lab-grown replacement neurons into the brains of patients with Parkinson's, with promising early outcomes.

news.heading: China
news.content: A study by the Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air found that China's carbon emissions declined in the 12 months up to May 2025, even as demand for new power generation grew rapidly.
news.source: Centre for Research on Energy and Clean Air

news.heading: India
news.content: A report by the United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA) noted that India's population growth has stabilized, with the fertility rate dropping below the replacement level of 2.1 in some states.

news.heading: Japan
news.content: The government announced a new initiative to boost the birth rate by offering financial incentives for couples to have a second child, in response to the country's ongoing demographic crisis.

news.heading: China
news.content: The National Bureau of Statistics (NBS) reported that China's population is now officially in decline, with the number of births falling for the ninth consecutive year.
news.source: National Bureau of Statistics of China

news.heading: Pakistan
news.content: Pakistan won the World Food Programme’s Global Food Security Award for its efforts to combat hunger and malnutrition.

news.heading: India
news.content: The Bihar Museum Biennial 2025 commenced with exhibitions by various Asian, African, and South American countries.

news.heading: Japan
news.content: On July 15, the Japan Art Association announced the winners of its 36th Praemium Imperiale, an international art award.

news.heading: India
news.content: The World Health Organization (WHO) has confirmed four cases of the Nipah virus in Kerala, India, with two fatalities. This marks the ninth Nipah outbreak in the state since 2018.

news.heading: Gaza
news.content: The WHO has confirmed that around 100 people died of malnutrition-related deaths by the end of July.

news.heading: Tuvalu
news.content: Australia and Tuvalu formalized the historic Falepili Union. This agreement supports Tuvalu's population by providing a pathway for them to live, study, and work in Australia as climate impacts worsen.
news.source: Australian Government Department of Foreign Affairs and Trade

news.heading: Australia
news.content: Geoscience Australia received international recognition for geospatial excellence for its development of the Digital Atlas of Australia.

news.heading: Jamaica
news.content: The Archaeological Landscape of 17th Century Port Royal, Jamaica, gained World Heritage status from UNESCO.

news.heading: Border Carbon Adjustment Proposal
news.content: Seven Group Holdings CEO, Mr. Stokes, has proposed a Border Carbon Adjustment (BCA) to level the playing field for Australian industries facing higher environmental standards compared to overseas competitors. This proposal aims to protect domestic businesses and reduce carbon leakage.

news.heading: Germany
news.content: Economic activity was sluggish, with GDP falling by 0.1% quarter-on-quarter in Q2.

news.heading: Switzerland
news.content: Switzerland's president presented a 'more attractive' tariff offer to the White House following President Trump's decision to hit the country with steep tariffs.

news.heading: EU-Russia
news.content: The EU adopted an 18th sanctions package against Russia in response to the war in Ukraine. The package includes new measures to limit Russia's energy revenues, such as lowering the oil price cap from $60 to $47.6 per barrel.

news.heading: Sweden
news.content: The Swedish government has provided SEK 20 million to the International Atomic Energy Agency's (IAEA) missions in Ukraine.

news.heading: Turkey
news.content: Turkey recorded its highest-ever temperature of 50.5°C (122.9°F) as it battled wildfires, highlighting the persistent effects of a warming climate.
news.source: Associated Press (AP) via Copernicus Climate Change Service

news.heading: Ireland
news.content: A survey by Ipsos revealed that people in Ireland are the most concerned about immigration control out of 30 countries surveyed. This worry is linked to infrastructural issues following years of underinvestment in housing, utilities, and critical services.

news.heading: The International Court of Justice (ICJ)
news.content: The ICJ issued a landmark advisory opinion on July 23, 2025, stating that countries have a binding obligation under international law to protect the climate system.

news.heading: European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR)
news.content: The ECtHR issued landmark decisions finding that Russia has committed grave violations of international humanitarian law in Ukraine since 2014.
news.source: The European Court of Human Rights (ECtHR)

news.heading: Ukraine
news.content: Ukraine launched a large drone attack on Russian military bases, successfully attacking more than 40 aircraft of the Russian Air Force as part of 'Operation Spiderweb.'

news.heading: Ukraine
news.content: A polio outbreak has been reported in Kyiv, with 12 cases confirmed. The WHO and local health authorities are working to conduct a vaccination campaign and trace contacts.

news.heading: Switzerland
news.content: The UEFA Women's Euro 2025 was held throughout July.

news.heading: France
news.content: The Tour de France, one of the most prestigious cycling events in the world, took place throughout the country from July 5-27.

news.heading: Mexico
news.content: The Mexican national football team won a record-extending 10th Gold Cup title after defeating the United States 2-1 in the final in Houston, Texas.

news.heading: Scientific Research
news.content: The British Antarctic Survey (BAS) announced that a consignment of ancient ice from Antarctica, part of the Beyond EPICA – Oldest Ice project, arrived for detailed analysis.

news.heading: Vice Presidential Election Announced
news.content: The Election Commission of India (ECI) has announced that the election for the 17th Vice President of India will be held on September 9, 2025. This follows the resignation of Jagdeep Dhankhar.

news.heading: Monsoon Session of Parliament
news.content: The government has told an all-party meeting that it is ready to discuss all issues raised by the Opposition in the Monsoon session of Parliament. This includes addressing the ongoing debate over U.S. President Donald Trump's claims on 'Operation Sindoor'.

news.heading: Prime Minister's Foreign Visit
news.content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi concluded a two-nation tour to the United Kingdom and the Maldives. During his visit to the U.K., he was expected to finalize a bilateral free trade agreement.
news.source: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), Government of India

news.heading: NITI Aayog's Initiatives
news.content: NITI Aayog has been active with several new initiatives. This includes the launch of the third edition of "Trade Watch Quarterly" and a new roadmap to strengthen State Science & Technology (S&T) Councils, aimed at empowering states through science.

news.heading: RBI Holds Repo Rate
news.content: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) decided to keep the repo rate unchanged at 5.5% in its bi-monthly monetary policy review. This decision was made to balance inflation management with the need for sustained economic growth.

news.heading: GST Collections Show Growth
news.content: India's gross Goods and Services Tax (GST) collection for July 2025 reached a significant ₹1.96 lakh crore. This represents a 7.5% increase year-on-year, indicating a healthy economic recovery.
news.source: Press Information Bureau (PIB), Ministry of Finance

news.heading: New UPI Rules
news.content: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) implemented new rules for UPI transactions starting August 1, 2025. These rules, which cap daily balance inquiries and auto-debit retries, are designed to improve system efficiency and reduce network congestion.

news.heading: India-US Trade Tensions
news.content: India's relationship with the United States is facing strain due to new US tariffs on Indian goods. The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has called these tariffs "unjustified," reiterating that India's oil imports are based on its national energy security needs.
news.source: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), Government of India

news.heading: India-Philippines Bilateral Visit
news.content: At the invitation of Prime Minister Modi, the President of the Philippines, H.E. Mr. Ferdinand R. Marcos Jr., paid a State Visit to India from August 4-8, 2025. This visit was a key part of India's 'Act East' policy to strengthen strategic partnerships.
news.source: Ministry of External Affairs (MEA), Government of India

news.heading: India Joins Artemis Accords
news.content: India has become a signatory to the Artemis Accords, a NASA-led international agreement for peaceful and sustainable space exploration. This move solidifies India's role as a leading spacefaring nation.

news.heading: NISAR Satellite Launched
news.content: The NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) satellite, a joint Earth observation mission between the two space agencies, was successfully launched on July 30, 2025. The satellite will provide crucial data for studying Earth's changing surfaces.

news.heading: Indian Startup Builds 3D-Printed Rocket Engine
news.content: Indian space startup Agnikul Cosmos has built the world's largest single-piece 3D-printed rocket engine from a high-performance superalloy. The company has also been granted a US patent for this innovative design.

news.heading: ISRO's Planetary Defence Efforts
news.content: ISRO has joined global efforts in asteroid monitoring and planetary defence. ISRO Chairman S. Somanath emphasized the importance of collaboration with agencies like NASA to develop technologies to deflect potentially hazardous asteroids.

news.heading: July Was Earth's Third-Hottest
news.content: The European Union’s Copernicus Climate Change Service reported that July 2025 was the third-hottest July on record globally, with Asia experiencing warming at twice the global average.

news.heading: Climate-Resilient Agriculture
news.content: A report on agriculture climate news for July 2025 indicates a 15% increase in the adoption of climate-resilient crops in India. This is part of the country's national strategy to ensure a stable food supply amid changing weather patterns.

news.heading: UN Population Award 2025
news.content: Varsha Deshpande, the secretary of Dalit Mahila Vikas Mandal, was awarded the UN Population Award 2025 for her lifelong work in promoting gender equality and preventing sex-selective abortions in India.

news.heading: Supreme Court Ruling on Mental Health
news.content: In a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court of India declared that mental health is a fundamental right under Article 21. The court also issued 15 nationwide guidelines for educational institutions to protect students' mental well-being.

news.heading: New Criminal Laws Enacted
news.content: On July 1, 2025, three new criminal laws—the Bharatiya Nyaya Sanhita, the Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita, and the Bharatiya Sakshya Adhiniyam—were formally enacted, replacing the colonial-era Indian Penal Code, Code of Criminal Procedure, and Indian Evidence Act.
news.source: Ministry of Home Affairs (MHA), Government of India

news.heading: Supreme Court Ruling on Spousal Conversations
news.content: The Supreme Court of India ruled that secretly recorded conversations between spouses can be admissible as evidence in matrimonial disputes, balancing the right to privacy with the need for a fair trial.

news.heading: National Film Awards
news.content: The 72nd National Film Awards were announced. The film Maharani won Best Feature Film, while actor Manoj Bajpayee was honored with the Best Actor award for his role in Gulmohar.
news.source: Press Information Bureau (PIB), Ministry of Information and Broadcasting

news.heading: UN Population Award
news.content: Varsha Deshpande received the UN Population Award 2025 for her work on gender equality and preventing sex-selective abortions.

news.heading: INS Nistar Commissioned
news.content: Hindustan Shipyard Limited delivered INS Nistar, India's first indigenous diving support ship. The vessel is designed for deep-sea diving and rescue operations and is a significant addition to the Indian Navy's fleet.
news.source: Ministry of Defence, Government of India

news.heading: Indian Navy Launches New Craft
news.content: The Indian Navy launched the third of eight Anti-Submarine Warfare Shallow Water Craft (ASW-SWC). The vessel, named Arnala, will replace the existing Abhay-class ASW corvettes, enhancing the Navy's capabilities.
news.source: Ministry of Defence, Government of India

news.heading: Kargil Vijay Diwas
news.content: India commemorated the 26th anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas on July 26, 2025, to honor the bravery and sacrifice of the Indian soldiers in the 1999 Kargil War.
news.source: Press Information Bureau (PIB), Ministry of Defence

news.heading: Guru Purnima
news.content: The festival of Guru Purnima was celebrated on July 10, 2025. It is a day dedicated to honoring and showing gratitude to spiritual and academic teachers across the country.
news.source: Ministry of Culture, Government of India

news.heading: United Nations (UN)
news.content: The UN Security Council held a special session to address the escalating conflict in Sudan and the flow of weapons into neighboring South Sudan.

news.heading: World Health Organization (WHO)
news.content: The WHO, in partnership with the Government of Brazil, hosted the 2025 Global Conference on Climate and Health in Brasília.

news.heading: World Trade Organization (WTO)
news.content: The WTO's General Council held its quarterly meeting to address ongoing global trade tensions and the impact of rising tariffs.

news.heading: NATO
news.content: The North Atlantic Council, NATO's principal political decision-making body, met to discuss a new strategy for cyber defense in response to a rise in state-sponsored attacks.
